unnormalised: ## The Coaching Hustle: My JEE Prep Story
normalised: ## The Coaching Hustle: My J-E-E Prep Story

unnormalised: It feels like just yesterday I was drowning in textbooks, fueled by endless cups of chai and the unwavering hope of cracking the JEE. The whole coaching industry seemed like a massive beast, promising success at the cost of sanity, and honestly, I was both terrified and excited. Mom and Dad had enrolled me at Allen in Kota; it was supposed to be the best, the place that churned out toppers every year.
normalised: It feels like just yesterday I was drowning in textbooks, fueled by endless cups of chai and the unwavering hope of cracking the J-E-E. The whole coaching industry seemed like a massive beast, promising success at the cost of sanity, and honestly, I was both terrified and excited. Mom and Dad had enrolled me at Allen in Kota; it was supposed to be the best, the place that churned out toppers every year.

unnormalised: Leaving home was tough. I missed mom’s cooking, the familiar chaos of my Delhi neighborhood, even arguing with my younger brother. Kota was… different. It was all about the grind. Every waking moment was dedicated to physics, chemistry, and maths. Early morning classes started at 7:00 AM sharp, followed by hours of practice problems. We barely had time to breathe, let alone think about anything else. Mock tests every Sunday were like mini-Jee's, setting our anxiety levels through the roof. I remember one test where I scored a measly 120/360. Devastating!
normalised: Leaving home was tough. I missed mom’s cooking, the familiar chaos of my Delhi neighborhood, even arguing with my younger brother. Kota was… different. It was all about the grind. Every waking moment was dedicated to physics, chemistry, and maths. Early morning classes started at seven A-M sharp, followed by hours of practice problems. We barely had time to breathe, let alone think about anything else. Mock tests every Sunday were like mini-J-E-E's, setting our anxiety levels through the roof. I remember one test where I scored a measly one hundred and twenty divided by three hundred and sixty. Devastating!

unnormalised: The pressure was immense. Everyone around me seemed so much smarter, faster, and more dedicated. The competition was cutthroat. I’d hear whispers of students studying till 3:00 AM, solving problems I couldn’t even comprehend. There were days when I felt like giving up, like I wasn’t cut out for this. My friends back in Delhi were having fun, while I was stuck in a cycle of studying, testing, and feeling inadequate.
normalised: The pressure was immense. Everyone around me seemed so much smarter, faster, and more dedicated. The competition was cutthroat. I’d hear whispers of students studying till three A-M, solving problems I couldn’t even comprehend. There were days when I felt like giving up, like I wasn’t cut out for this. My friends back in Delhi were having fun, while I was stuck in a cycle of studying, testing, and feeling inadequate.

unnormalised: But amidst the stress and self-doubt, there were also moments of camaraderie. We'd huddle together during breaks, comparing notes, sharing shortcuts, and trying to decipher particularly nasty problems. There were also the teachers, some of whom truly cared. Mr. Sharma in Physics, for instance, had a knack for explaining complex concepts in a way that even I could understand. He really pushed me to think critically, not just memorize formulas. He even predicted one question would come for sure, and it did!
normalised: But amidst the stress and self-doubt, there were also moments of camaraderie. We'd huddle together during breaks, comparing notes, sharing shortcuts, and trying to decipher particularly nasty problems. There were also the teachers, some of whom truly cared. Mister Sharma in Physics, for instance, had a knack for explaining complex concepts in a way that even I could understand. He really pushed me to think critically, not just memorize formulas. He even predicted one question would come for sure, and it did!

unnormalised: One turning point was the All India Test Series (AITS). Seeing my rank improve, slowly but surely, gave me a much-needed boost of confidence. Scoring 280/360 in one of the AITS felt like a huge victory. It validated all the hard work I'd been putting in. That one score convinced me I might actually have a shot.
normalised: One turning point was the All India Test Series (A-I-T-S). Seeing my rank improve, slowly but surely, gave me a much-needed boost of confidence. Scoring two hundred and eighty divided by three hundred and sixty in one of the A-I-T-S felt like a huge victory. It validated all the hard work I'd been putting in. That one score convinced me I might actually have a shot.

unnormalised: Looking back, my JEE prep journey was a rollercoaster. It was intense, demanding, and often overwhelming. But it also taught me resilience, discipline, and the importance of perseverance. I managed to get a decent rank, enough to get into an NIT. Not IIT, but still something to be proud of.
normalised: Looking back, my J-E-E prep journey was a rollercoaster. It was intense, demanding, and often overwhelming. But it also taught me resilience, discipline, and the importance of perseverance. I managed to get a decent rank, enough to get into an N-I-T. Not I-I-T, but still something to be proud of.

unnormalised: And while I wouldn’t necessarily recommend the Kota life to everyone, it definitely shaped me into who I am today. Now at age 25, as a software engineer making 25 LPA, I realize, it wasn't about the rank, it was about the journey. And I wouldn't trade that experience for anything.
normalised: And while I wouldn’t necessarily recommend the Kota life to everyone, it definitely shaped me into who I am today. Now at age twenty five, as a software engineer making twenty five L-P-A, I realize, it wasn't about the rank, it was about the journey. And I wouldn't trade that experience for anything.
